description: The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) is an art museum located in Midtown Manhattan. The institution was conceived in 1929 by Abby Aldrich Rockefeller, Lillie P. Bliss, and Mary Quinn Sullivan.
The Whitney has moved several times and is now located on Gansevoort Street in the Meatpacking District.
The Metropolitan Museum of Art located in Central Park is the largest museum in America.
The American Museum of Natural History is a natural history museum on the Upper West Side.
The Guggenheim is an art museum at 1071 Fifth Avenue between 88th and 89th Streets on the Upper East Side.
Cooper Hewitt is a design museum at the Andrew Carnegie Mansion in Manhattan,
The Seagram Building is a skyscraper at 375 Park Avenue, between 52nd and 53rd Streets, in the Midtown designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe.
detail: Seagram Building Marks Apex Of Mies van der Rohe's Career

description: The MetLife Building (formerly the Pan Am Building) is a skyscraper at Park Avenue and 45th Street, north of Grand Central Terminal.
detail: '200 Park Avenue' Preferred As Airline Heads South.

description: The Guggenheim is an art museum at 1071 Fifth Avenue between 88th and 89th Streets on the Upper East Side.
detail: The Guggenheim: Has a building ever inspired strong emotion in you?
